definition:
A [*filtration*]{} is a sequence of sets $A_1, A_2, \dots, A_n$ with
$$A_1 \subset A_2 \subset \cdots \subset A_n.$$ If one considers the
sets $A_1, \dots, A_n$ as elements of a larger set which are partially
ordered by inclusion, then a filtration is simply a finite chain with
respect to this partial ordering. It should be noted that in some
contexts the word “filtration” may also be employed to describe an
infinite chain.
